channel.title: Hey yea.. i'm back can any one tell me step by step how BIOS,BOOT UP & P.O.S.T
channel.description:
Yea i said i was going away from the cyber net but it just didn't happen thanks to my dam computer exam. i just need helping understanding how BIOS,BOOT UP & P.O.S.T all these work if any one found a link to it can u post it here or if you know how it works can u post it here for me to plz, also i need to know them step by step like for Boot up system: 1.Boots up 2. Checks the drives for boot up file like that and thats all i know
if you can help me it would be great thx

item.title: Hey yea.. i'm back can any one tell me step by step how BIOS,BOOT UP & P.O.S.T
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

BIOS

BIOS (/ˈbaɪɒs/ BY-oss; an acronym for Basic Input/Output System and also known as the System BIOS, ROM BIOS or PC BIOS) is non-volatile firmware used to perform hardware initialization during the booting process (power-on startup), and to provide runtime services for operating systems and programs. The BIOS firmware comes pre-installed on a personal computer's system board, and it is the first software to run when powered on. The name originates from the Basic Input/Output System used in the C


en.wikipedia.org

Power-on self-test

A power-on self-test (POST) is a process performed by firmware or software routines immediately after a computer or other digital electronic device is powered on. This article mainly deals with POSTs on personal computers, but many other embedded systems such as those in major appliances, avionics, communications, or medical equipment also have self-test routines which are automatically invoked at power-on. The results of the POST may be displayed on a panel that is part of the device, output t...

Two good starting points.

Read full topic
